word_mean: 生殖：生殖行为，生殖过程
世代，一代：由来自共同远祖的历代祖先中辈数相同的子代全体所组成的层次，或家系图中位于同一代的全部个体
具有共同祖先并在系谱上处于同一等级水平的一群生物个体。
有世代交替的生物体从一个生殖期到下一个生殖期为一个世代。

sentence.Network_en: A new generation of scientists became fascinated by dinosaurs.
sentence.Network_cn: 新一代科学家对恐龙研究着了迷。

sentence.Network_en: First-generation Americans view the United States as a land of golden opportunity.
sentence.Network_cn: 第一代美国人认为美国是一个充满了机遇的国度。

sentence.Network_en: This challenge will occupy Europe for a generation or more.
sentence.Network_cn: 这将是欧洲在未来二三十年或者更长的时间里所要面临的挑战。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin generatio(n-), from the verb generare (see generate)

entry.tran: （尤指经历或观点相同的）一代人，同代人，同辈人
entry.def: A generation is all the people in a group or country who are of a similar age, especially when they are considered as having the same experiences or attitudes.

example.ex: David Mamet has long been considered the leading American playwright of his generation.
example.tran: 长期以来，戴维·马梅特一直被视为同代人中最杰出的美国剧作家。

entry.tran: 代，一代，一辈（通常认为大约是30年）
entry.def: A generation is the period of time, usually considered to be about thirty years, that it takes for children to grow up and become adults and have children of their own.

example.ex: Within a generation flight has become the method used by many travellers.
example.tran: 就在不到一代人的时间里，坐飞机已经成了很多旅行者的出行方式。

entry.tran: （机械设备的设计和制造的）代
entry.def: You can use generation to refer to a stage of development in the design and manufacture of machines or equipment.

entry.tran: （表示家庭成员拥有某国国籍的时间长短情况）第…代的
entry.def: Generation is used to indicate how long members of your family have had a particular nationality. For example, second generation means that you were born in the country you live in, but your parents were not.

example.tran: 英国的第二代亚洲移民

example.ex: She is a first generation American.

entry.def: Generation is also the production of a form of energy or power from fuel or another source of power such as water.

example.ex: Japan has announced plans for a sharp rise in its nuclear power generation.
example.tran: 日本宣布了大幅增加核能发电的计划。

means.word_mean: 1. all the people living at the same time or of approximately the same age
2. group of genetically related organisms constituting a single step in the line of descent
3. the normal time between successive generations;

sentences.sentence: "they had to wait a generation for that prejudice to fade"

means.word_mean: 4. a stage of technological development or innovation;
6. the production of heat or electricity;

sentences.sentence: "dams were built for the generation of electricity"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of producing offspring or multiplying by such production

Sentence.sentence: They weren't looking for cured meats, organic produce or beautiful presentation; they were looking for whatever they could get their hands on, and this prioritisation of quantity over quality prevailed for decades, meaning a generation was brought up with food that couldn't compete with neighbouring France, Italy, Belgium or Spain.

means.word_mean: 同时代的人, 一代人, 一代，同代人，同辈人

sentences.en: People of my generation all think the same way about this.
sentences.cn: 关于这件事, 我们这代人都有同感。

sentences.en: Steam and water power are used for the generation of electricity.
sentences.cn: 蒸汽和水力可用来发电。

sentences.en: The biology class studied the generation of fruit flies.
sentences.cn: 生物班的学生研究了果蝇的繁殖。

jushi.english: The biology class studied the generation of fruit flies.
jushi.chinese: 生物班的学生研究了果蝇的繁殖。

jushi.english: People of my generation all think the same way about this.
jushi.chinese: 关于这件事,我们这代人都有同感。

jushi.english: Three generations of the family have been born and brought up in this old house.
jushi.chinese: 这个家族的三代人都是在这所古老的房子里出生和成长的。
